One of the things that makes this particular set
so accurate is that it uses the technology
that Sony developed in the sixties

When electron guns were developed
they weren't entirely accurate.
And often electrons would stray
from their intended path causing them to
activate other unintended phosphorus.
It wasn't a big issue with black and white televisions
but once colors got involved
stray electrons hitting nearby phosphorus
would unacceptably distort the image
with unintended colors and fuzziness.
To solve this RCA developed the shadow mask
a metal sheet full of tiny holes
that would block stray electrons
